events.description: The release of foreign direct investment data for Vietnam for the month of January 2026.

facts.fact_text: Foreign direct investment disbursed in Vietnam reached USD 1.68 billion in January 2026, an 11.3% increase year-on-year.

evidences.evidence_text: Foreign direct investment (FDI) disbursed in Vietnam reached USD 1.68 billion in January 2026, up 11.3% year-on-year from USD 1.51 billion

facts.fact_text: Total registered FDI in Vietnam fell 40.6% to USD 2.57 billion in January.

evidences.evidence_text: total registered FDI fell 40.6% to USD 2.57 billion

facts.fact_text: Manufacturing and processing sectors received 76.3% of the FDI share.

evidences.evidence_text: manufacturing and processing accounted for the largest share (76.3%)

facts.fact_text: Singapore was the largest investor in Vietnam, contributing 41.5% of total registered capital.

evidences.evidence_text: Singapore remained the largest investor with 41.5% of total registered capital

claims.claim_text: The FDI data reflects sustained investor confidence in Vietnam.
claims.author: Ministry of Finance

evidences.evidence_text: The Ministry of Finance said the data reflect sustained investor confidence

claims.claim_text: Global supply chain shifts are influencing investment patterns in Vietnam.
claims.author: Ministry of Finance

evidence.evidence_text: signaling continued expansion of foreign business activities
the data reflect sustained investor confidence amid global supply chain shifts
the data reflect sustained investor confidence
